member.name: T:DevHorizons.DAL.Abstracts.Command
member.summary:
The DAL Command abstract class which holds all the required members and operations to access the database and T-SQL command executions.
This abstract class can be used for the DI (Dependency Injection) design pattern.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.Abstracts.Command.dataExecutionSuccessful
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the specified command (stored procedure) execution has been completed from the data source side.
member.value: true if the specified command (stored procedure) execution has been completed from the data source side; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
This value will be represnted by the "".
If true, but error(s) or warning(s) are being raised, it means an error/warning from the engine client data layer side which could be issue in output parameter updates, output data transforamtion, etc.
If the command is doing any 'DML' operation on the database, it's always recommended to check the "" value before trying to rerun this operation again to avoid data inconsistency (data quality issues like data duplicates).

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Attributes.DataFieldAttribute.AllowNull
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the mapped column in the designated table in the database is nullable.
member.value: true if this input value can be null; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
Default Value: false.
Even if the host property is nullable type, this attribute is overriding the property behaviour.
If set to "false" while the value is null, then this property will be skipped from the data inputs into the database.

member.name: T:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheMethod
member.summary: Defines all the possible cache containers options for the internal metadata information.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheMethod.None
member.summary: The cache is being disabled for the specified action/cache level.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheMethod.Memory
member.summary:
Using the built-in memory cache ("") on the host machine which is following life cycle of the host application and usually being hosted in a Singleton Dependency Injection life cycle.
The most recommended option for the best performance. However, it can consume significant amount of memory on the host server depends on the number of data models registered in the host application.
You can monitor the allocated memory (in bytes) for this option for the designated levels using from the "" class. E.g. "".

member.name: T:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheSettings
member.summary: Defines all the needed cache settings for the data access layers.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheSettings.Disabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the whole cache module is being disabled including all the level of cache. Not recommended action because it may affect the performance of the engine unless you are quite sure what you are doing.
The Default Value: false.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheSettings.DisableSecondLevel
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Second Level Cache is being disabled. Not recommended action because it may affect the performance of the engine unless you are quite sure what you are doing.
The Default Value: false.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheSettings.MemoryCacheThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum (in bytes) whereas the memory cache can hold.

remarks.para: Does not apply on the first level cache.

If new cache is required to be persisted above the threshold, it will be rejected and a warning will be raised to decide later if you would like to increase the threshold and/or increase the host server memory.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheSettings.RaiseErrorsAsWarnings
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the engine will raise all the cache related errors as warning instead of errors.
If set to "true", all the cache related errors will be silently ignored and command executions will not fail or get terminated.
If set to "true", the DAL command ("") will raise warning which can be captured by the "" event handler.
The Default Value: false.
member.remarks: If set to "true" and if the logging is not disabled (""), those errors will be logged as warnings.

member.name: M:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.CacheSettings.IsSecondLevelCacheAllowed
member.summary: Check if the whole cache is allowed as well as the second level cache.
member.returns: true if the whole cache is allowed as well as the second level cache.

member.name: T:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.IMemoryCache
member.summary: Defines all the internal components which can be cached into the built-in memory cache on the host machine which is following life cycle of the host application and usually being hosted in a Singleton Dependency Injection life cycle.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.IMemoryCache.DataProviderFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal data provider factory generator. It's strognly recommended to be cached in the memory (it will conly preserve few bytes) to save time each time a connection is opened with the data source.
member.remarks: Part of the first level cache.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.IMemoryCache.CachedDataFields
member.summary:
Gets or sets the internal list of the extracted attributes of data fields mapping.
Caching these list for each model would avoid doing this operation each time the engine is attempting to map the query result into the designated models/types which in turn could save performance especially with large models with complix designs.
member.remarks: Part of the second level cache.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Cache.IMemoryCache.CachedProperties
member.summary:

Caching these list for some types to avoid this reflection operation each time.
member.remarks: Part of the second level cache.

member.summary: Encrypt the specified text/string using the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) cipher with a symmetric key (two way symmetric encryption).
member.param: The data settings of the "DAL" engine.

If set to true, each time the same exact source/decrypted data will encryted to a unique value. Which means, you cannot run SQL query on it in the data source itself. The only way to validate it or process it, is to use the "DAL" engine to export and it will automatically decrypt it for you.
member.returns: An instance of "" which would hold the encrypted data in "Base64" string or the output error details if failed.

If the "HashKey" is not specified/set, the hashing functionality will not work and exceptions will be raised if the functions are encryption/decryption functions are required as per the consumers/developer instructions.

member.name: M:DevHorizons.DAL.Interfaces.ICommand.CommitTransaction(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Commit the current opened transaction and dispose it.
member.param:
If true it will ignore any raised error from the advance executed queries/command. Otherwise else, If error or more being raised by any command/query execution after the transaction being started, the auto rollback will be executed ("").
This should not be set to "true" because it may lead to data inconsetancy, unless you intend/plan to handle the raised errors manually with a proper way. Otherwise else, always set it to false.
If true and the commit failed, the auto rollback will be executed ("").
member.returns: true if the transaction has been started successfully, otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If the transaction fails to start, or failed to be commited, the current transaction will be disposed, furthermore, the whole "DAL" service will be susbended from executing any further commands/transactions until the reset operation is being executed by calling the "" method.

member.name: M:DevHorizons.DAL.Interfaces.ICommand.CommitTransaction(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Commit the current opened transaction and dispose it.
member.param: If true and the commit failed, the auto rollback will be executed ("").
member.returns: true if the transaction has been started successfully, otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
If the transaction fails to start, or failed to be commited, the current transaction will be disposed, furthermore, the whole "DAL" service will be susbended from executing any further commands/transactions until the reset operation is being executed by calling the "" method.
If error or more being raised by any command/query execution after the transaction being started, the auto rollback will be executed ("").

member.name: M:DevHorizons.DAL.Interfaces.ICommand.CommitTransaction
member.summary: Commit the current opened transaction and dispose it. If the commit operation failed, the auto rollback will be executed ("").
member.returns: true if the transaction has been started successfully, otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
If the transaction fails to start, or failed to be commited, the current transaction will be disposed, furthermore, the whole "DAL" service will be susbended from executing any further commands/transactions until the reset operation is being executed by calling the "" method.
If error or more being raised by any command/query execution after the transaction being started, the auto rollback will be executed ("").
If you need more control, consider looking at the other overloads of this method.

member.name: M:DevHorizons.DAL.Interfaces.ICommand.RollbackTransaction
member.summary: Rollback the current opened transaction and dispose it.
member.returns: true if the transaction has been rolled back successfully, otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When executed (either the rollback operation is a success or failure), the current transaction will be disposed, furthermore, the whole "DAL" service will be susbended from executing any further commands/transactions until the reset operation is being executed by calling the "" method.

member.name: M:DevHorizons.DAL.Interfaces.ICommand.ExecuteTranCommands(System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{DevHorizons.DAL.Interfaces.ICommandBody})
member.summary: Executes all the specified commands within an opened transaction (for the same opened/shared connection) with the default isolation level set by the target database server.
member.returns: true if the command has been executed successfully with errors free; otherwise else, false.
member.remarks:
If the transaction fails to start/begin, or failed to be commited, the current transaction will be disposed, furthermore, the whole "DAL" service will be susbended from executing any further commands/transactions until the reset operation is being executed by calling the "" method.
If error or more being raised by any of the lised/specified commands execution after the transaction being started, the auto rollback will be executed (""), and whole operation will be immediatly rerminated before executing the rest of the commands as a safe measurement to avoid wasting unnessary further computing resources.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.Interfaces.ILogDetails.DataExecutionSuccessful
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the specified command (stored procedure) execution has been completed from the data source side.
member.value: true if the specified command (stored procedure) execution has been completed from the data source side; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
If true, but error(s) or warning(s) are being raised, it means an error/warning from the engine client data layer side which could be issue in output parameter updates, output data transforamtion, etc.
If the command is doing any 'DML' operation on the database, it's always recommended to check for this value before trying to rerun this operation again to avoid data inconsistency (data quality issues like data duplicates).

member.name: T:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings
member.summary: Defines all the data source connection/access related settings.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the whole connection string for the data access.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings.DbConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source connection instance of the type "".
member.remarks:
It doesn't matter if the connection is opened or closed. If closed, the engine will open it.
If the "" property is specified, it will override the encapsulated connection string.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings.DatabaseName
member.summary:
Gets or sets the name of the targeted/connected database.
This is optional because the target database can be specified as part of the connection string "".
If specified, it will override the one specified in the connection string "".

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings.CommandTimeout
member.summary:
Gets or sets the wait time (in seconds) before terminating the attempt to execute a command and generating an error.
The Default Value: Null.
member.remarks:
If Null, it will use the default value of the data source system. For exampe, if it's SQL Server, then it will be 30 seconds.
A value of 0 indicates no limit (an attempt to execute a command will wait indefinitely).
This property is the cumulative time-out (for all network packets that are read during the invocation of a method) for all network reads during command execution or processing of the results. A time-out can still occur after the first row is returned, and does not include user processing time, only network read time.
For example, with a 30 second time out, if Read requires two network packets, then it has 30 seconds to read both network packets. If you call Read again, it will have another 30 seconds to read any data that it requires.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings.ConnectionLifetime
member.summary:
Gets or sets the specified seconds for how long an underlying connection can exist before the driver closes the underlying connection instead of returning it to the connection pool upon connection object close. Idle pooled connections are closed and removed from the pool once they reach the defined Connection Lifetime.
The Default Value: Null.
member.value: The connection lifetime in seconds.
member.remarks:
If not specified, it will use the default value which is (0). A value of zero (0) causes pooled connections to have the maximum connection timeout.
This setting will be merged with the provided connection string and will override the same setting if exists.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary:
Gets or sets the length of time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to the server before terminating the attempt and generating an error.
The Default Value: Null.
member.value: The connection timeout in seconds.
member.remarks:
Valid values are greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 2147483647.
If not specified, it will use the default value which is (15) seconds.
A value of zero (0) will set the connection timeout to the maximum.
This setting will be merged with the provided connection string and will override the same setting if exists.

member.name: P:DevHorizons.DAL.IConnectionSettings.ConnectionPooling
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the connection pooling is allowed or not.
The Default Value: Null.
member.value: The true, the connection pooling is allowed, otherwise; false.

remarks.para: If not specified, it will use the default value which is (true). By default the connection pooling is enabled for the same identical connection string parameters/values.
You may only need to set it to false to disable it.
This setting will be merged with the provided connection string and will override the same setting if exists.

member.name: T:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Specifies the transaction locking behavior for the connection.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel.Unspecified
member.summary:
A different isolation level than the one specified is being used, but the level cannot be determined.
An exception is thrown if this value is set.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel.Chaos
member.summary: The pending changes from more highly isolated transactions cannot be overwritten.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel.ReadUncommitted
member.summary: A dirty read is possible, meaning that no shared locks are issued and no exclusive locks are honored.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel.ReadCommitted
member.summary: Shared locks are held while the data is being read to avoid dirty reads, but the data can be changed before the end of the transaction, resulting in non-repeatable reads or phantom data.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel.RepeatableRead
member.summary: Locks are placed on all data that is used in a query, preventing other users from updating the data. Prevents non-repeatable reads but phantom rows are still possible.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel.Serializable
member.summary: A range lock is placed on the System.Data.DataSet, preventing other users from updating or inserting rows into the dataset until the transaction is complete.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.IsolationLevel.Snapshot
member.summary: Reduces blocking by storing a version of data that one application can read while another is modifying the same data. Indicates that from one transaction you cannot see changes made in other transactions, even if you requery.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.Shared.DbType.Double

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.Shared.DbType.Guid

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.Shared.DbType.Int16
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 16-bit integers with values between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: F:DevHorizons.DAL.Shared.DbType.Int32
